column4: I'm trying to play something with mplayer and I'm getting "alsa-lib: pcm_hw.c:1242:(snd_pcm_hw_open) open /dev/snd/pcmC0D0p failed: Device or resource busy"  Is there something I can do to force it to not be busy?
does your sound work at all?  and are you using gnome (ubuntu)
It worked a while ago.  I am using gnome
I've had this happen in the past and it will work after I restart, but there has to be a better solution
does your sound work right now?  try System->Preferences->Sound and see if it works
that does not work.  It says something about not being able to write to the device
try changing your sound device in System->Preferences->Sound .  also are you in the 'audio' group?  try 'group YOURLOGINNAMEHERE'
It isn't a group issue.  using mplayer as root doesn't work either
are you in the audio group?
can you play test sounds in the sound control panel ?
there's a command to let the alsa utilities to go out and figure out which sound card it should be using, i think
Yes.  It worked just a while ago.  There is some command to release all of the audio devices but i can't remember it
what happens if you restart alsa ?
sudo /etc/init.d/alsa-utils restarts but still doesn't work
